articles.author: Katie Hunt, CNN
articles.title: Why some dinosaurs had such long necks - CNN
articles.description: The largest animals to ever walk the Earth were sauropods -- long-necked dinosaurs that could grow the length of three school buses. Their huge size was likely a response to a shift in climate 180 million years ago, new research suggests.

articles.title: 'Dueling dinosaurs' fossils show Triceratops, T. rex, may have died after a battle - msnNOW
articles.description: About 67 million years ago, a Triceratops horridus and a Tyrannosaurus rex died and were quickly buried together side by side in a single grave. It's the kind of showdown scientists have speculated about for years. The fossils go on dislay in 2022.
